Text.val: The Sync variable is onscreen to make the example easier to test.
In this Call operation, the Sync property is being set by a variable that is
on the screen. Changing the Sync property will change when the parent
If no data exists in the Address table, then create it.

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 When you have a one-to-many data structure, there is an issue of when the parent record is committed in relation to the child. This is controlled by the Sync property of the Call Operation.\par \par In this example, if you:\par \par 1. Make a change to the parent record (change the first name, for example)\par 2. Open the phones screen.\par \par If \cf2 Sync\cf1 is not checked, you will not see the change you made to the parent task.\par \par If \cf2 Sync\cf1 is checked, you will see the change you made to the parent.\par \par }

ExpSyntax.val: 'SQ03_How Do I Implement a One-to-Many Relationship in Magic when there is a Database Constraint?'

Text.val: Assign the next phone seq if this is a new record
If this record is newly created, save the new seq number
